snippet: The ruling challenges the legitimacy of the only sitting house of Parliament and the body that drafted the country’s new constitution.
abstract: Egypt's Supreme Constitutional Court rules that laws governing election of country's only operating house of Parliament, as well as body that drafted Egypt's post-revolutionary Constitution, were invalid; ruling further erodes legal standing of Pres Mohamed Morsi and the legislature, but is unlikely to have any immediate practical effects.
lead_paragraph: The ruling challenges the legitimacy of the only sitting house of Parliament and the body that drafted the country’s new constitution.

headline.seo: Egyptian Court Rules Against Legislative Body
headline.main: Egypt Court Chips Away at Influence of President
headline.print_headline: Egypt Court Chips Away At Influence Of President
